*** Bug 195328 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I notice that there is a org/eclipse/mylyn/monitor/ui/AbstractEditorTracker.class

So is it just a matter of doing a rename?

George: it looks like there is something wrong with your Mylyn configuration, because that class is indeed there.  I'm not sure what you mean by "doing a rename".  Could you be using a subset of Mylyn that is missing ..mylyn.monitor.ui?

Mik,
  All my classes are from the Europa site and from the Mylyn extras zip.

I meant that since the exception was for the missing class:

org/eclipse/mylyn/monitor/ui/workbench/AbstractEditorTracker

but there is a:

org/eclipse/mylyn/monitor/ui/AbstractEditorTracker


class, it looks like there is some confusion over what the the name should be.

   George

Thaks for clarifying.  I can't find anything in the code that refers to the old org/eclipse/mylyn/monitor/ui/workbench/AbstractEditorTracker class.  Could you try removing any old plug-ins from your configuration and see if that resolves it, and if not provide steps to reproduce (e.g. happens on startup, happens when you perfrom some action).

OK,
  I've tracked it down. Starting from a virgin 3.3 installation, I finally
was able to reproduce the error after I installed the subclise plugin
from http://subclipse.tigris.org/update_1.2.x

Now I see this error when I first do Window->Show view->Other

At this point there is no AbstractEditorTracker.class in the plugins
directory.

   George

I don't think Subclipse or its integration for Mylyn is using AbstractEditorTracker either. What suggest is to uninstall Mylyn, then make sure there is no org.eclipse.mylyn.* folders or jars in your Eclipse installation and then install it again.

Tracked it down to the springide release 200706171744

    http://springide.org/project/changeset/2135

    For some reason the normal eclipse update search does not pick on the 
    200706271108 release. It was only by doing an explicit update on the
    plugin that I saw the new release.
Good that you tracked it down George.  So I assume that resolved the problem.  CC'ing Christian in case anyone reports something similar against Spring IDE.
